module_restrictions: Exchange students should take courses matching their field. Business modules are meant for Business major students from NUS Business School.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from certain countries do not need a visa to enter Germany. Students from all other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country.
accommodations_info: Students can apply for student housing or private accommodations. The university recommends all exchange students from non-EU countries to purchase a statutory German health insurance for about €89/month.
university_description: The University of Mannheim is a public research university located in Mannheim, Germany. It has a notable reputation for Business and Economics programs.
location_cost_of_living: Mannheim is known to be an affordable city for students, even though the cost of living may vary depending on personal lifestyle choices.
location_weather: Mannheim experiences a temperate oceanic climate with relatively mild winters and warm summers.
location_description: Mannheim is the third-largest city in the state of Baden-Württemberg, Germany, and has a rich history, having served as the royal capital of the Electorate of the Palatinate.
location_crime: Mannheim has a relatively low crime rate compared to other cities in Germany.
location_transportation: Mannheim has an extensive public transportation network with trams, buses, and trains servicing the city and the surrounding area.
location_halal: Halal food options are available in Mannheim.
location_vegetarian: Vegetarian food options are available in Mannheim.
